The main benefit is that almost all of required actions might be done by non-developers.

initial_reviews.review_title: Ever-improving one-stop shop for customer messaging.
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Vero Cloud?
Vero initially shines in its versatility. It tries to be your single source for all things messaging. While I've mostly used it for emails, it also does push notifications and the like. One area where it really simplified our flow was in its ability to not only tackle newsletter emails, but also transactional emails. A product like Mailchimp formerly relied on a companion product, Mandrill to achieve the same feat. With Vero, it's all built-in.

While previously having an acceptable 'live' email template interface for tweaking emails, they now have a fully  WYSIWYG interface that allows marketers to not have to create their own emails without much knowledge of the intricacies of email HTML/CSS. Pair this with a robust rules interface that you can use to target specific segments and for specific events, and you get a pretty powerful solution for engaging with your customers.

Vero has steadily been improving their UI, and it's now quite good. This used to be a point of friction, as it could lag and some elements suffered from glaring usability issues, like email templates.

Lastly, the team is a pleasure to deal with. They're always very accommodating with customer support requests and are thoughtful.

What do you dislike about Vero Cloud?
While not specifically a detraction of Vero itself, I don't believe it supports a direct integration with Salesforce. While there are solutions out there to connect the two, it's not as robust as a solution like Pardot that is tightly integrated with Salesforce. Customers that need that level of integration are probably better off with that, but for most, especially those with another CRM solution, Vero gets the job done admirably.

What problems is Vero Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
We use Vero for our transaction emails and some of our marketing emails as well. Our team has also experimented with Pardot for newsletter-related emails.

initial_reviews.review_title: Data Driven Marketing Automation
initial_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Vero Cloud?
This is by far the best customer success team I've worked with in email marketing. Not only do they respond within the hour, but they have a solution to my problem within the day.
The software allows for great customization by letting more complex data flow from our data warehouse into the MAP. The API is an integral part of their product offering and the emphasis on event-driven email workflows means that ignoring it is missing a lot of the value. Because of this, leads will be able to receive the respective emails that are more focused on where they are in the buying funnel based on actions that they take. The workflows and behavior generated automatic emails have a great UI, making it very easy to see which emails contacts could be sent. I also really love having different environments to do email testing/building without "dirtying up" my actual sending environment. This is the only MAP I've seen that does this and it makes implementation and building out campaigns so much nicer.

What do you dislike about Vero Cloud?
The software itself is more technical than others where it might not be user friendly to the general marketer. all_reviews.review_title: Powerful tool, but really clunky UI
all_reviews.review_content:
What do you like best about Vero Cloud?
Great features for developers and programmers. Our email sends have been consistent. Strong API that works really well. Great templating features that allow for dynamic insertion of fields and the ability to make certain parts of the template editable for other users or campaigns. Great price point - we were able to reduce our monthly cost by about 60%. They also have great support that has been very prompt with their responses to even our most difficult questions.

What do you dislike about Vero Cloud?
Hate the UI. It's really clunky and doesn't take you through the logical order when sending an email. This makes the process of setting up and sending an email significantly more time consuming. Deliverability rates are also slightly below those that we had on our old email platform. If you're not a programmer or developer, I'd recommend using another service.

Recommendations to others considering Vero Cloud:
Really only valuable if you have developers or programmers on staff. There are many other softwares with better UIs that can do a better job for the average user.

What problems is Vero Cloud solving and how is that benefiting you?
We were previously using a managed email service that was significantly more expensive. Vero helped us migrate away from that and minimize our variable cost of each send.
